page.title: 02MADELEY STAFFS : POPULATION
page.content: The population of the area is almost 2350 of all ages from 0-85+.While most are English by birth some are Welsh or Scots & a few are immigrants.Nearly 75% of the population live on 1 of 3 modern estates,the rest living in older type housing,spread throughout the area,or in the 16 scattered farmsteads on the edge of the village. On the modern estates there is a frequent turnover of population some 10% leaving & moving into the area annually.The older houses change hands less frequently,however. Of the 1791 people aged 16+,1077 work or are seeking employment.209 are retired.The remainder is made up of women at home & students.When the College of Education shut in 1982 nearly 1200 people left the area-a great loss to the communtiy.
